channel.title: Sports
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Sports, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mick Schumacher's First Oval Test at Homestead: 'It Can Only Go Better From Here'
item.description: INDYCAR rookie Mick Schumacher is getting the hang of things after driving laps on an oval for the first time at Homestead-Miami test.

item.title: James Rodríguez To MLS: Colombia Star Confirms Minnesota United Move
item.description: Minnesota United officially announced the signing of Colmbia star James Rodríguez, who will begin his first spell in Major League Soccer.

item.title: LIV Golf Riyadh: Peter Uihlein, Elvis Smylie Tied for Lead After Day 3
item.description: Elvis Smylie matched veteran Peter Uihlein at 16 under par in a thrilling Day 3 at LIV Golf Riyadh on Friday.

item.title: World Cup 2030: USA, Mexico Learn CONCACAF's Automatic Qualifying Spots
item.description: CONCACAF announces it will have six automatic qualifying spots in the 2030 World Cup.

item.title: Pro Football Hall of Fame Considers Voting Changes After Belichick Omission
item.description: The Pro Football Hall of Fame is considering voting changes after coach Bill Belichick's omission sparked outrage.

item.title: Games open with tributes to Italian culture, icons
item.description: Featuring tributes to da Vinci and Dante, Puccini and Pausini, Armani and Fellini, pasta and vino, and other tastes of Italian culture, an unprecedent...

item.title: Lunardi's Bracketology tiers for every high-major men's basketball conference
item.description: Breaking down the March Madness potential for every team from the ACC, Big East, Big Ten, Big 12 and SEC.

item.title: Women's Bracketology: Are the No. 1 seeds already locked in?
item.description: Texas' win over LSU on Thursday makes it tougher for teams such as the Tigers or Vanderbilt to get to a 1-seed.

item.title: QB Mendoza: Combine throwing not a 'priority'
item.description: Indiana quarterback and presumptive No. 1 pick Fernando Mendoza explained his decision not to throw during the NFL scouting combine, saying he preferr...

item.title: Sources: Kingsbury joining McVay's Rams staff
item.description: Former Commanders offensive coordinator Kliff Kingsbury is joining the Rams' coaching staff, sources told ESPN.
